query: Grasshopper Adventure Series gravel race Northern California

videos.title: NorCal adventure racing: King Ridge Grasshopper preview
videos.description:
Race it, ride it, or do a little bit of both: the series closer to the 28th annual Grasshopper Adventure Series is King Ridge, held May 10 in Duncan's Mills, California.

https://www.grasshopperadventureseries.com/

-
Gear I use for shooting (not sponsored):
Hover X1 Promax Self-Flying Drone: https://amzn.to/4goWzgp
DJI Mini 3 Drone: https://amzn.to/3wK4eVY
DJI Action Cam 5: https://amzn.to/4ije8Ax
DJI Pocket Osmo 3: https://amzn.to/3wK4eVY

--
The Ride is supported in 2025 by:
Castelli clothing: http://tinyurl.com/43k6pftp
Perc coffee: https://tinyurl.com/fjr7nurr (save 15% with code 'ride15')
Saris racks: https://saris.com/collections/racks# (save 15% with code 'ben15')
Silca maintenance: https://bit.ly/47xxvzj (save 10% with code 'theridewithben10')
BikeTiresDirect: https://tinyurl.com/yc7vxujh (save 10% with code 'THERIDE') 
The Cyclist Lawyer: https://www.thecyclist-lawyer.com/
Shimano shoes & glasses: http://tinyurl.com/ye274tep
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://bit.ly/3S9Dq8r
videos.transcript:
The Grasshoppers are a NorCal cycling
tradition of adventure, camaraderie, and
competition. Today we are out here
riding the King Route, a road event that
will be held May 10th. Road? What? This
is gravel. This is Grasshopper. What are
you talking about? Oh, I Yeah, I thought
Well, you know, a good ride's a good
ride. And out around here, uh, it just
happens to be, but some of the most
spectacular road riding for Chance in
the world. So, I mean, I need to put
have that as part of our series. You've
put on mountain bike events, you put on
road events. A lot of them span the
spectrum. Way before gravel was even a
thing, you were doing these
multi-surface events. So, it's a treat
for me to get out here and ride these
roads. Some of which are dirt, some of
which are paved, some of which are are
chunky pavement. And we invite you to
come along for the ride.
[Applause]
[Music]
riding in uh this part of the world in
this corner uh is very special and
unique. Uh the geography is very
particular with I guess the meeting of
the tectonic plates here makes it like
so rugged and it's very unexpected what
is coming next and that keeps it uh very
very fun and challenging and yeah makes
it for very fun riding. So the
grasshoppers are one of the best
interjections of like getting people
connected with nature, enjoying being
with each other, big sense of commuting
it, pushing each other. Either you want
to push or not, the terrain kind of
makes you push it and brings the
challenge and it always feels good. Uh
at the end of the day, many grasshopper
events are point-to-point races. The
King Ridge is the timed segment format.
For the long route, there are three
segments. For the short, there are two.
I like this format because you get to
scratch the competitive itch, go hard,
and then when you get dropped, you get
to regroup with your old and new
friends. What was the thinking for you
behind as a promoter behind these time
segments? Well, it's interesting you
asked that. So, it is unique to the
Grasshoppers. We've done that uh once
before. So, uh the first reason is to
put on an event back in Sonoma County
where I felt that it was safe, you know,
with the size of our riders and it's on
open roads. um that's above anything
else is the most important and I wanted
to do a big epic loop in Sonoma County.
Right. So I'm calling this the greatest
hits. We have Joy and Coleman Valley and
King Rage, but we have sections of
Highway 1. This is a chance for us to
really push ourselves. They're really
hard long segments, but like you said,
to be able to regroup and to to gather
afterwards, tell stories a little bit
and then and then, you know, roll on
out. For people unfamiliar with the
area, briefly walk us through the
course, where we start, how we climb up
and over the ridge down to the ocean.
Yeah, so we start in Duncan Mills. It's
a small little town of less than a
thousand people on the Russian River, a
couple miles from the coast. And uh we
we roll out up overland. We used to
start through Freestone. And uh and then
we climb up Joyce. We're heading out
towards Bedadega, which is a famous
little town where Hitchcock filmed the
birds. This is rural western Soma
County. We call it Oxonal, the West
Pole. Okay. Um, it's kind of the the hub
of road rides, adventures, and out to
the coast. There are some steep kickers
coming up and over the bridge here. What
What is this gradient? This is like
right at the start of this climb. Oh no.
Start of segment one kicking the teeth.
I'm just glad that my computer says 16%.
My legs say 26%.
Just a just a 16% grade to start off the
day.
But 17% like a perfect 16%
road to take us to the exact same point.
Ouch. Ouch. All the way out to put in a
pretty way. That would be nice. Yeah.
We're going to be finishing here uh this
segment where we are right now at the on
Coleman Valley before you drop into the
coast. So you get to pause and take in
this spectacular
view. Heat. Heat.
Once you catch your breath and roll up
the coast and then we go up, we go up
Myers grade. It's tend generally people
like to come down that because of the
speed and the view. So, um I love this
direction myself. Um and it's little bit
unknown to some people in terms of even
if they live out here on um you know lot
very few people have even know what
their times are up that. So, it's we're
we're mixing it up. And then we end up
on the top of Hower Bridge up by by King
Rage and Tinbar where it's going to end.
And then we get to roll all the way back
through Kazadero and in into back to
there just casually with your friends
chatting. It'll be the end of our
series. We'll have brick oven pizza at
uh at Gold Coast Coffee and uh yeah,
that's our event. Alex, you've ridden
and raced your bike all over the world.
What's it like to ride in Sonoma County?
Oh my goodness. Um a dream come true. Uh
I actually live in Sonoma County. first
house I've ever owned. So, most of the
Grasshopper Adventure Series actually
happens on my home roads. I think it's
the best road riding in the entire
world, plus mixed terrain, cuz you never
know what's going to hit you at a
Grasshopper Adventure Series. Even some
of the pavement, you know, this is a the
one quote unquote road event. But the
road is spicy. It's textured. I was
happy to have big wide tires on that rub
and that rub headshock. Yeah, the future
shock is definitely a game changer here.
So, Specialized uh Rubet, I ride this uh
Specialized Rubé SL8 with 32 millimeter
tubless tires. Um, and we were talking
about it today, but riding uh here I
call it the Soma Tapestry. It's just a
beautiful asphalt with a bunch of
patchwork that they didn't finish. Like
a heavy corduroy shag carpet. It's like
your grandma's quilt, but it's on
asphalt.
Climbs are steep. Like we're pushing 16,
17, 18%. What's the What's the gearing?
It's like a compact crank. The the move
compact crank and I'm have a 36 in the
back. A little party gear there. The
bike for me is my custom Mosaic
XT1. Um, which is a cross bike, but it's
essentially an all-road bike. So, I
think an all-road bike with between 30
mil and 34 mil tires would be fine. Um,
but our friend Jav's out here on 28s and
rim brakes with carbon wheels and you
could do that as well. Just bring your
legs. I think that's the most that's the
most important part is doesn't matter
what bike you bring just as long as you
have the legs. Today I rode uh my road
bike uh with 30s tubeless. There's it's
mostly all road except cruise that we
are about to do. Uh but I've done it on
the road bike and it's not a bad setup.
Uh it depends on how comfortable you are
with uh uh that type of bike, but I do
love it and that's why I'm riding it.
Don't try this at home, kids.
I think that I saw it. So Miguel, when
you started the Grasshoppers 28 years
ago, what was what was the vision? What
was the drive? When I started the
Grasshoppers, you know, I was racing
regionally as a pro mountain biker. love
that experience and the challenge and
everyone's going their hardest taking
care of yourself. But when I travel to
do some road races in the threes, uh if
you weren't in the in the break, then
the rest of the day was just negative.
Like so you'd travel and people would
just just sit up and I wanted to to put
the put them on the best roads in Sonoma
County, the most challenging things, but
everybody turning them inside out. And I
think that's the thing that we've
evolved over time. People, it's the
personal challenge and then you're
always, you know, you're digging deep.
So, it's a it's an event where you're
challenging yourself personally and with
your friends and and it's a huge
accomplishment if someone's finishing
for their their PR or on the podium. And
I think that we we continue to strive to
do that and create a place where people
can either be racing for that or, you
know, have their best day on the bike.
And often times it's through really,
really difficult, challenging, beautiful
terrain. What are what are some of your
favorites here? I know this is like the
the the greatest hits, but you know what
what are a couple of your favorite
favorite stretches of road on this on
this course on this particular one
today? um you know on the ridge on
Coleman Valley dropping down the bo both
the views and and just the I don't know
the swishiness of the road and you drop
in unulates like we were talking about
it's like doing a you know a high blue
black diamond mountain bike trail but on
your road bike it's got that same
sineuousness of being on the edge and
that best there was like one best line
on these little roads so that's one um
up along the view up along grade for the
view of that and then what's not part of
the time segment dropping down Fort Ross
which we just did which is kind of a
pucker up descent. Yeah, that was spicy.
What we just did drop into here with I
mean I like to descend. I like to go
downhill and then to be in the trees but
to be able to get this views like this
to have it open up. A lot of our events
we're in the woods we're in the trees
we're in the thick of it and this one
we're like trees open trees open ocean.
So it keeps like it you know feeling
feeling different. Gives perspective you
know. Um, I think we'd like that as
cyclists to be able to just like be in
nature, have it be quiet, but also be
able to take a peek around. King Ridge
is the finale to the 2025 Grasshopper
Adventure Series. May 10th in Duncan's
Mills, California. If you're in the Bay
Area, come on up. Give it a crack. If
you're elsewhere in the world, check out
the Grasshopper series for your 2026
calendar. Regardless of whether you're
able to join us or not, I hope watching
this is maybe giving you a bit of
inspiration to get out there on your
bike and enjoy the ride.

videos.title: The Megahopper: 9 of California's Grasshopper Gravel Races Mixed into One Massive Ride by Ted King
videos.description:
The Grasshopper Adventure Series are a staple in northern California's cycling scene. Beautiful mixed terrain events snaking all over Sonoma County. The Megahopper is an amalgamation of nine Grasshoppers in one truly epic ride covering 415 miles and more than 43,000 feet of elevation gain.

With the goal of an OKT (only known time) to help introduce this route to the public, Ted set out with videographers Avery Stumm and Adin Beard to see how quickly he could cover the route and showcase it for the masses. 

Bike:
Cannondale SuperSix EVO SE
SRAM Red/Eagle Drivetrain. 46t front chainring, 10-50 Eagle Cassette
SRAM Red calipers and levers
Zipp Firecrest 303 Wheelset
Zipp cockpit: stem + handlebars
Rene Herse 700x48mm Hatcher Pass tires
Moosepacks half-frame bag in Harlequin
Outvi Possm saddle bag
Cycliq Fly 6 rear light/camera

Velocio kit
ROKA eyewear

UnTapped nutrition. A lot of UnTapped nutrition. Yum yum.

Ride link: https://ridewithgps.com/trips/76213302

videos.title: 2022 Full G.A.S California Gravel Race Huffmaster Grasshopper Adventure Series
videos.description:
This is my experience at the 2022 Huffmaster Grasshopper Adventure Series Bicycle race. One of the longest running mixed terrain "gravel" race series in the country, the Grasshopper Adventure Series, is one of my favorite bicycle events. I've been riding "racing" these events going as far back as 2006-2007 when I first learned about this crazy alternative to the then popular road racing scene. My first race was on a road bike with 23mm tires. While this event has grown in popularity, it still retains its community focus. Anyone can ride, or race, this event and there are no limits to what bicycle you can use. It's mostly about fun, but there are a few fast riders there looking to take the home a win. 

2022 Results:
https://runsignup.com/Race/Results/112590#resultSetId-302796;perpage:100

Event Organizer Website:
https://grasshopperadventureseries.com/rides/huffmaster-hopper-april-20th/
tags: 2022 Full G.A.S Huffmaster Grasshopper Adventure Series Bicycle Race

videos.title: Grasshopper Adventure Series 2018 - Old Caz BIKE RACE! Report
videos.description:
The Old Caz Grasshopper is a premiere bike adventure ride taking place each year in January, and starting in the Northern California town of Occidental. It's now in its 20th year, and only getting stronger. This years event bought in over 600 cyclists eager to take to the back roads of West Sonoma County. This adventure ride/race is difficult to classify. Is it a training ride, a race, or just an awesome adventure? Maybe it's all of the above, I think so, but no matter what, it brings out some of the best amateur and professional cyclist's from the area with the same goal in mind, go fast and have fun. As any have pointed out there is no perfect bike choice for this ride with the old standing motto still holding true "ride what you bring." This year, I rode a hardtail mountain bike with oversized road tires. Last year (2017) I rode a road bike with 28mm slicks. No matter what I ride, I still get about the same time, providing I don't get any flats. I hope you enjoy my race day break-down and please stick around till the end where I will discuss possible ways I might improve on my time next year, this could benefit you too!

A link to the race page and results:
http://grasshopperadventureseries.com/rides/old-caz/
tags: grasshopper adventure series old caz bike race
videos.transcript:
Today I am going to be doing a quick
race report for the old Cazadero
Grasshopper which I competed in over the
weekend. As some of you may know, I
prepared a few short videos leading up
to the event and I'll post a few cards
here at the top of your screen. Please
stick around to the end of this video.
That's where I offer some tips and
advice on what I could have done
differently to improve my time overall.
[Music]
got a passion here. Oh shoot, you left
on to me.
So, in today's video, I'm going to treat
this kind of like a race report. I know
I've said in the previous videos that
I've made leading up to this that it's
not really a bike race, but
the reality is it is ridden like a bike
race. And you have for the most part
bike racers who show up to do this event
leading up to the actual ride. I
produced a couple videos showing the
creek crossing and also some of the
upgrades I was making to this bike. But
what I left out was what tire choice I
was making. That decision to leave that
out was unintentional. I wanted to get a
feel for how wet the roads were going to
be and how wet the trails were going to
be or how wet they would still be after
all the rain we had. So the tire I chose
was this is the Compass Snowquali Pass.
I used the standard weight casing and it
is a 44 mm wide tire. So, I have never
actually used the bigger ones, but I was
very curious to what they're able to
provide in terms of ride quality,
rolling resistance, and all that. And
everything that I have read uh indicated
to me that these were probably a pretty
fast rolling tire, aside from the fact
that they're also very light compared to
other XC or crosscountry tires that you
would find on a hard tail mountain bike.
I'm not saying this is the best bike to
ride for this event, but between the
bikes that I had, I found that this one
was my most my best compromise. So, the
pressure that I used for the day of the
event was 40 PSI in the back and 35 in
the front. I do feel in looking back now
after the results of the race that that
was an a pretty ideal tire pressure to

videos.title: Huffmaster Supports Camp & Ranch Fire Support Efforts
videos.description: Huffmaster Hopper April 20th, 2019. Special Event from Hopper Adventures. Proceeds to benefit Camp and Ranch Fire efforts.
videos.transcript:
the beer ad foundation being a nonprofit
has the ability to help folks out and so
using it as a tool we thought that you
know we can create a creep an incredible
hopper event and raise some money for
folks that are in need it's personally
relevant to me because my family and I
we lost everything in the Tubbs fire in
2017 which at that point was the worst
fire in the history of the state and
even just the next year it got up to by
what happened in total devastation with
the camp fire and then just the sheer
acreage of the ranch fire which are the
two fire funds that we're going to be
supporting
